Function Documentation

DIRTYCODE_API ProtoSSLRefT* ProtoSSLAccept ( ProtoSSLRefT *  pState,
int32_t  iSecure,
struct sockaddr *  pAddr,
int32_t *  pAddrlen 
)

Accept an incoming connection.

Parameters
*pState- module state reference
iSecure- flag indicating use of secure connection: 1=secure, 0=unsecure
*pAddr- where the client's address should be written
*pAddrlen- the length of the client's address space
Returns
ProtoSSLRefT * - accepted connection or NULL if not available
Version
10/27/2013 (jbrookes)

References ProtoSSLRefT::bServer, DirtyMemGroupEnter(), DirtyMemGroupLeave(), ds_memcpy(), ProtoSSLRefT::iClosed, ProtoSSLRefT::iMemGroup, ProtoSSLRefT::iState, ProtoSSLRefT::PeerAddr, ProtoSSLRefT::pMemGroupUserData, ProtoSSLCreate(), ProtoSSLDestroy(), ProtoSSLRefT::pSecure, ProtoSSLRefT::pSock, SOCKERR_NONE, SocketAccept(), SocketClose(), SocketInfo(), ST3_RECV_HELLO, ST_UNSECURE, and TRUE.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLConnect ( ProtoSSLRefT *  pState,
int32_t  iSecure,
const char *  pAddr,
uint32_t  uAddr,
int32_t  iPort 
)

Make a secure connection to an SSL server.

Parameters
*pState- module state reference
iSecure- flag indicating use of secure connection (1=secure, 0=unsecure)
*pAddr- textual form of address (1.2.3.4 or www.ea.com)
uAddr- the IP address of the server (if not in textual form)
iPort- the TCP port of the server (if not in textual form)
Returns
int32_t - SOCKERR_xxx (zero=success, negative=failure)
Version
03/08/2002 (gschaefer)

References ProtoSSLRefT::bCertInfoSet, ProtoSSLRefT::CertInfo, DirtyCertStatus(), FALSE, ProtoSSLRefT::iState, NetPrintf, ProtoSSLRefT::PeerAddr, ProtoSSLRefT::pHost, ProtoSSLRefT::pSock, SockaddrInGetAddr, SockaddrInit, SockaddrInSetAddr, SockaddrInSetAddrText(), SockaddrInSetPort, SOCKERR_INVALID, SOCKERR_NONE, SOCKERR_NORSRC, SocketLookup(), SocketOpen(), ST_ADDR, ST_CONN, and ProtoSSLRefT::strHost.

Referenced by ProtoWebSocketConnect().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLControl ( ProtoSSLRefT *  pState,
int32_t  iSelect,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

ProtoSSL control function. Different selectors control different behaviors.

Parameters
*pState- module state reference
iSelect- control selector
iValue- selector specific
iValue2- selector specific
*pValue- selector specific
Returns
int32_t - selector specific
Note
Selectors are:
        SELECTOR    DESCRIPTION
        'alpn'      Set the ALPN protocols (using IANA registerd named) as a comma delimited list
        'ccrt'      Set client certificate level (0=disabled, 1=requested, 2=required)
        'ciph'      Set enabled/disabled ciphers (PROTOSSL_CIPHER_*)
        'extn'      Set enabled ClientHello extensions (PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_*), (default=0=disabled)
        'host'      Set remote host
        'maxr'      Set max recv rate (0=uncapped, default)
        'maxs'      Set max send rate (0=uncapped, default)
        'ncrt'      Disable client certificate validation
        'rbuf'      Set socket recv buffer size (must be called before Connect())
        'resu'      Set whether session resume is enabled or disabled (default=1=enabled)
        'sbuf'      Set socket send buffer size (must be called before Connect())
        'scrt'      Set certificate (pValue=cert, iValue=len)
        'secu'      Start secure negotiation on an established unsecure connection
        'skey'      Set private key (pValue=key, iValue=len)
        'skep'      Set socket keep-alive settings (iValue=enable/disable, iValue2=keep-alive time/interval)
        'spam'      Set debug logging level (default=1)
        'vers'      Set client-requested SSL version (default=0x302, TLS1.1)
        'vmin'      Set minimum SSL version application will accept
Version
01/27/2009 (jbrookes)

References ProtoSSLRefT::aAlpnProtocols, ProtoSSLRefT::bAllowAnyCert, ProtoSSLRefT::bKeepAlive, ProtoSSLRefT::bReuseAddr, ProtoSSLRefT::bSessionResumeEnabled, DS_CLAMP, ds_strnzcpy(), FALSE, ProtoSSLRefT::iCertificateLen, ProtoSSLRefT::iClientCertLevel, ProtoSSLRefT::iMaxRecvRate, ProtoSSLRefT::iMaxSendRate, ProtoSSLRefT::iPrivateKeyKen, ProtoSSLRefT::iRecvBufSize, ProtoSSLRefT::iSendBufSize, ProtoSSLRefT::iState, ProtoSSLRefT::iVerbose, NetPrintf, NetPrintfVerbose, ProtoSSLRefT::pCertificate, ProtoSSLRefT::pPrivateKey, PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5, PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA, ProtoSSLRefT::pSock, SocketControl(), SSL3_VERSION_MAX, SSL3_VERSION_MIN, SSL_ALPN_MAX_PROTOCOLS, ST3_SEND_HELLO, ST_UNSECURE, ProtoSSLRefT::strHost, AlpnProtocolT::strName, TRUE, ProtoSSLRefT::uAlpnExtensionLength, ProtoSSLRefT::uEnabledCiphers, ProtoSSLRefT::uHelloExtn, ProtoSSLRefT::uKeepAliveTime, AlpnProtocolT::uLength, ProtoSSLRefT::uNumAlpnProtocols, ProtoSSLRefT::uSslVersion, and ProtoSSLRefT::uSslVersionMin.

Referenced by ProtoHttpControl(), and ProtoWebSocketControl().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLSend ( ProtoSSLRefT *  pState,
const char *  pBuffer,
int32_t  iLength 
)

Send data to the server over secure TCP connection (actually, whether the connection is secure or not is determined by the secure flag passed during the SSLConnect call).

Parameters
*pState- module state reference
*pBuffer- data to send
iLength- length of data (if negative, input data is assumed to be null-terminated string)
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, otherwise number of bytes sent
Version
06/03/2002 (gschaefer)

References SecureStateT::iSendSize, ProtoSSLRefT::iState, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), ProtoSSLUpdate(), ProtoSSLRefT::pSecure, ProtoSSLRefT::pSock, ProtoSSLRefT::SecureCrit, SOCKERR_CLOSED, SocketSend, SSL3_REC_APPLICATION, SSL_SNDLIM_PACKET, ST3_SECURE, and ST_UNSECURE.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLSetCACert ( const uint8_t *  pCertData,
int32_t  iCertSize 
)

Add one or more X.509 CA certificates to the trusted list. A certificate added will be available to all ProtoSSL instances for the lifetime of the application. This function can add one or more PEM certificates or a single DER certificate.

Parameters
*pCertData- pointer to certificate data (PEM or DER)
iCertSize- size of certificate data
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, positive=count of CAs added
Note
The certificate must be in .DER (binary) or .PEM (base64-encoded) format.
Version
01/13/2009 (jbrookes)

References TRUE.

Referenced by ProtoHttpSetCACert().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLSetCACert2 ( const uint8_t *  pCertData,
int32_t  iCertSize 
)

Add one or more X.509 CA certificates to the trusted list. A certificate added will be available to all ProtoSSL instances for the lifetime of the application. This function can add one or more PEM certificates or a single DER certificate. 

This version of the function does not validate the CA at load time.
The X509 certificate data will be copied and retained until the CA
is validated, either by use of ProtoSSLValidateAllCA() or by the CA
being used to validate a certificate.
Parameters
*pCertData- pointer to certificate data (PEM or DER)
iCertSize- size of certificate data
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, positive=count of CAs added
Note
The certificate must be in .DER (binary) or .PEM (base64-encoded) format.
Version
04/21/2011 (jbrookes)

References FALSE.

Referenced by ProtoHttpSetCACert2().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLStat ( ProtoSSLRefT *  pState,
int32_t  iSelect,
void *  pBuffer,
int32_t  iLength 
)

Return the current module status (according to selector)

Parameters
*pState- module state reference
iSelect- status selector ('conn'=return "am i connected" flag)
pBuffer- buffer pointer
iLength- buffer size
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, zero=false, positive=true
Note
Selectors are:
        SELECTOR    DESCRIPTION
        'addr'      Address of peer we are connecting/connected to
        'alpn'      Get the negotiated protocol using the ALPN extension from the secure state
        'alrt'      Return alert status 0=no alert, 1=recv alert, 2=sent alert; alert desc copied to pBuffer
        'cert'      Return SSL cert info (valid after 'fail')
        'cfip'      TRUE/FALSE indication if a CA fetch is in progress
        'ciph'      Cipher suite negotiated (string name in output buffer)
        'fail'      Return PROTOSSL_ERROR_* or zero if no error
        'hres'      Return hResult containing either the socket error or ssl error
        'htim'      Return timing of most recent SSL handshake in milliseconds
        'maxr'      Return max recv rate (0=uncapped)
        'maxs'      Return max send rate (0=uncapped)
        'recv'      Return number of bytes in recv buffer (secure only)
        'resu'      Returns whether session was resumed or not
        'rsao'      Returns whether we are performing any RSA operations at this time
        'send'      Return number of bytes in send buffer (secure only)
        'serr'      Return socket error
        'sock'      Copy SocketT ref to output buffer
        'stat'      Return like SocketInfo('stat')
        'vers'      Return current SSL version
Version
03/08/2002 (gschaefer)

References ProtoSSLRefT::bAlertSent, SecureStateT::bSessionResume, ProtoSSLRefT::CertInfo, DIRTYAPI_PROTO_SSL, DIRTYAPI_SOCKET, DirtyErrGetHResult(), ds_memcpy(), ds_strnzcpy(), FALSE, ProtoSSLRefT::iLastSocketError, ProtoSSLRefT::iMaxRecvRate, ProtoSSLRefT::iMaxSendRate, SecureStateT::iRecvProg, SecureStateT::iRecvSize, SecureStateT::iSendProg, SecureStateT::iSendSize, ProtoSSLRefT::iState, SecureStateT::pCipher, ProtoSSLRefT::PeerAddr, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_BADDATE, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_HOST, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_INVALID, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_MISSING, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_NOTRUST, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_REQUEST, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_MAXVERS, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_MINVERS, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_NOCIPHER, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_NOTSSL, PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_SSL2, PROTOSSL_ERROR_DNS, PROTOSSL_ERROR_SECURE, PROTOSSL_ERROR_SETUP, PROTOSSL_ERROR_UNKNOWN, ProtoSSLRefT::pSecure, ProtoSSLRefT::pSock, SockaddrInGetAddr, SOCKERR_CLOSED, SocketInfo(), ST3_SECURE, ST3_SEND_KEY, ST3_SEND_VERIFY, ST_FAIL, ST_FAIL_CERT_BADDATE, ST_FAIL_CERT_HOST, ST_FAIL_CERT_INVALID, ST_FAIL_CERT_NONE, ST_FAIL_CERT_NOTRUST, ST_FAIL_CERT_REQUEST, ST_FAIL_CONN, ST_FAIL_CONN_MAXVERS, ST_FAIL_CONN_MINVERS, ST_FAIL_CONN_NOCIPHER, ST_FAIL_CONN_NOTSSL, ST_FAIL_CONN_SSL2, ST_FAIL_DNS, ST_FAIL_SECURE, ST_FAIL_SETUP, ST_WAIT_CA, SecureStateT::strAlpnProtocol, CipherSuiteT::strName, TRUE, ProtoSSLRefT::uAlertLevel, ProtoSSLRefT::uAlertValue, CipherSuiteT::uId, SecureStateT::uSslVersion, and SecureStateT::uTimer.

DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoSSLUpdate ( ProtoSSLRefT *  pState)

Give time to module to do its thing (should be called periodically to allow module to perform work). Calling once per 100ms or so should be enough. 

This is actually a collection of state functions plus
the overall update function. They are kept together for
ease of reading.
Parameters
*pState- module state reference
Version
11/10/2005 gschaefer

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLValidateAllCA ( void  )

Validate all CA that have been added but not yet been validated. Validation is a one-time process and disposes of the X509 certificate that is retained until validation.

Returns
int32_t - zero on success; else the number of certs that could not be validated
Version
04/21/2011 (jbrookes)
